channel.title: Posts on Rony Coelho
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Rony Coelho

item.title: Distribution of brazilian population (2019)
item.description: knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, warning=F, message=FALSE) With Codes library(dplyr) library(readxl) library(tidyverse) library(janitor) Load data pop = tempfile(fileext = ".xls") dataURL <- "ftp://ftp.ibge.gov.br/Estimativas_de_Populacao/Estimativas_2019/estimativa_dou_2019.xls" download.file(dataURL, destfile=pop, mode='wb') pop <- readxl::read_excel(pop, sheet =2, skip = 1) %>% clean_names() %>% drop_na() mapa <- brmap::brmap_municipio_simples %>% clean_names() # Manipular e mesclar bases pop <- pop %>% mutate(populacao_estimada = as.numeric(populacao_estimada), municipio_cod = paste0(cod_uf, cod_munic)) %>% drop_na() dados_brasil <- mapa %>% mutate(municipio_cod = as.character(municipio_cod)) %>% inner_join(pop, by = "municipio_cod") %>% select(municipio_cod, municipio_nome, lon, lat, populacao_estimada, geometry) Plot Brazil Map #X11() ggplot(data = dados_brasil) + geom_point(aes(x=lon,y=lat,size=populacao_estimada), colour = "#cffdfd", alpha = 0.

item.title: HDI-M and GINI in Brazil (1991, 2000, 2010)
item.description: Load libraries library(tidyverse) library(janitor) library(brmap) Load data idh_gini = tempfile(fileext = ".xlsx") dataURL <- "https://github.com/ronycoelho/databases/raw/master/idh_census.xlsx" download.file(dataURL, destfile=idh_gini, mode='wb') idh_gini <- readxl::read_excel(idh_gini, sheet =2) %>% clean_names() %>% select(ano, codmun7, gini, idhm) dt <- brmap_municipio %>% inner_join(idh_gini, by = c("municipio_cod" = "codmun7")) Theme map theme_map_br <- theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent"), panel.grid.major = element_line(color = "transparent"), axis.text.x = element_blank(), axis.text.y = element_blank(), axis.ticks = element_blank(), legend.position = "bottom", #legend.justification = c(1, 1), legend.

item.title: Other Graphics on my works
item.description: Scatterplot with notes See code plot <- ggplot(tb_final, aes(x= estr_inst, y= arq_part))+ geom_point(aes(fill=areas), show.legend=F, colour="black",pch=21, size=8, stroke=1.2, alpha=0.5)+ scale_fill_brewer(palette="Paired")+ scale_y_continuous(breaks = c(0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1))+ scale_x_continuous(breaks = c(0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1))+ geom_vline(xintercept = 0.48, linetype= "dotdash") + geom_text(aes(x=0.47, y=0.90, label="Média Estr. Inst = 0,48"), angle=90, size=7)+ geom_hline(yintercept = 0.58, linetype= "dotdash") + geom_text(aes(x=0.90, y=0.60, label="Média Arq. Part = 0,58"), size=7)+ geom_text(aes(label=areas), hjust=1, vjust=-0.5, size=8) + scale_size_area(max_size = 10)+ expand_limits (x = 0.

item.title: Municípios que podem ser extintos de acordo com a PEC do pacto federativo (PEC 188/2019)
item.description: Reprodução dos dados da Confederação Nacional dos Municípios - CNM Fonte: Siconfi Seleções: Exercício: 2018 Escopo: municipío Tabela: Receitas Orçamentárias (Anexo I-C) Inicializar #options(scipen=999) library(tidyverse) library(janitor) library(readxl) library(kableExtra) #setwd("C:/r_files/finbra") # nome do arquivo Rmd: cnn_reproducao Carregar dados # receitas rec <- read_csv2("finbra_2018_receitas.csv", skip = 3, locale(encoding = "ISO-8859-1"), col_names = TRUE, col_types = NULL) %>% janitor::clean_names() # populacao atualizada pop = tempfile(fileext = ".

item.title: Technical stuffs - Toc_float

R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document.
